task.title: Creating a database table
task.shortdesc: From the MOTODEV Database Explorer view you can create new tables within SQLite databases.

taskbody.prereq: You perform this task from within the MOTODEV Database Explorer view. This view is part of the MOTODEV Database perspective; switch to this perspective when working with Android databases.

step.cmd: Ensure that you are connected to the database.
Right-click the connected database file and select Create Table from the menu that appears.
step.stepresult: The Create New Table dialog appears.

step.cmd: Supply a name for the new table using the Table Name field.
Add columns to your table (you must create at least one). For each:

substep.cmd: Supply a name for the table column using the Name field.
If the column will contain a primary key, select Primary key and specify any automatic key behavior.
Ensure that the column type is correct. If necessary, select a different type.
If the table column should have a default value, specify it using the Default Value field.

step.cmd: Once you have specified all of the needed table columns, click Finish in the Create New Table dialog.

taskbody.result: The table is created and added to the database.

postreq.note: If you create the new table within a database on a connected device or running emulator, you may need to refresh the database (press F5, or right-click the database and select Refresh) in order for the change to be reflected on the device.
